title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Thursday, 12 May 2016 - BBC News
summary: american soldier gives her gold medal from the invictus games to papworth hospital as a thank you for saving her life .
new railway station in chesterton 'on track ' to open in a year 's time .
martina navratilova to be inaugurated as an honorary fellow at lucy cavendish college .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: live updates have finished for today .
we 'll be back tomorrow with the latest news , sport , weather and travel for cambridgeshire from 08:00 .
do n't forget you can get involved with our live page at any time by sending us your stories and via email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: weather : a mainly dry but misty night
text: it 'll be a mainly dry night , but will turn cloudy with mist and low cloud moving in .
minimum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
tomorrow , low cloud and mist should thin and there will be bright or sunny spells .
there is the risk of a shower in the morning .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 62f ) .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: education linked to fast food consumption , say experts
text: i 've been talking to the lead researcher of a team that carried out research into the link between eating healthily and how well you 're educated .

dr tom burgoine , from the centre for diet and activity research at the university of cambridge , says the better you 're educated means you 're more likely to spend more money and time on preparing and buying food .
he added `` the less money you have , you 're more likely to use your local takeaway that sells larger portions of food at lower prices '' .
he says limiting the number of takeaways in disadvantaged areas could be one solution .
author: Dotty McLeod
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : papworth hospital 's pride after invictus solider donates her gold medal transport secretary checks progress on cambridge 's new railway station
text: these are the main stories this afternoon :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: is this the earliest photo of a cambridgeshire police officer ?
text: and while cambridgeshire 's new police and crime commissioner spent the morning finding out about modern policing .
cambridgeshire police tweeted this photo from their archives of a 19th century officer in cambridge market square
rewinding back to the mid 1800s with one of our oldest images of an officer in cambridge # throwbackthursday # tbt

documents.title: cambridgeshire 's pcc enjoys 'fascinating ' first morning on the job
text: cambridgeshire 's new police and crime commissioner , jason ablewhite ( below left ) , spent this morning meeting front-line staff in cambridge .
he began with a briefing on the previous night 's crime in cambridge from area commander jon hutchinson ( above right )
went out on patrol with police constables ben and tony
and met up with the leader of the city rangers , as he supervised the community payback service .
mr ablewhite tweeted he had `` a fascinating morning seeing the highs and lows of cambridge life '' .

documents.title: a14 upgrade : concerns raised about location of construction sites
text: a parish councillor in madingley says a works-compound that 's being created less than a mile away from his village as part of the a14 upgrade could mean up to 100 lorries will be driven through the area every day , 24/7 .
edward byam cook says the site is not in the right area and highways agency should think again .
he says `` villagers are prepared to barricade the street '' to get their view points across .
highways england says it 's aware of the concerns raised and is having regular dialogue about the situation .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: papworth hospital 'delighted ' by invictus games medal donation
text: papworth hospital has thanked us solider elizabeth marks for asking prince harry to hand her gold invictus games medal to the hospital , as a thank you for saving her life .

dr roger hall , medical director at papworth , said : `` elizabeth 's fantastic achievement is a good example of how modern medicine can support all of us to not only lead a normal life , following life-threatening conditions , but go on to achieve truly amazing accomplishments . ''
the hospital said it was `` delighted '' by the gesture .
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: cambridge 's newest railway station 'on track '
text: i 'm not the only one here today finding out how the work to build the new railway station in chesterton is coming along .
the transport secretary patrick mcloughlin is also having a tour of the station , due to open in a year 's time .
he says it 's on track and will attract investment to the region .
it 's on track to open on time he says
when is that ?

documents.title: cambridge railway station a year from completion
text: in a year 's time a new train station will open in cambridge .
i 've come along to see how work is progressing at the £ 50m station in chesterton .
so far £ 13m has been spent .
we 'll find out in a month 's time which rail company will be using it .
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: invictus swimmer gives medal to medics
text: invictus swimmer gives medal to medics

documents.title: petition to let parents take kids on holiday during school term attracts 90k signatures
text: a petition lodged with parliament to allow parents to take children out of school during term time has attracted 93,573 signatures , with more peterborough residents signing up than anywhere else in the country .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: travel : frank perkins parkway reopens
text: the frank perkins parkway in peterborough has reopened after being closed for more than eight hours following a police incident .
it was closed at 05:00 .
traffic is still very slow in both directions between junction 7 , at oxney road , and junction 8 .
congestion goes back to junction 4 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: cambridge college courts tennis star
text: martina navratilova is to be inaugurated as an honorary fellow at lucy cavendish college in cambridge today .
the tennis legend said : `` i did not complete my schooling so to receive this fellowship is thrilling and exciting .
i am looking forward to being part of lucy cavendish college . ''
lucy cavendish college was founded in 1965 and is a women-only college , taking students aged 21 and over .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: weather : dry with warm sunny spells today
text: it will be a fine and dry afternoon , with good spells of sunshine .
in the sunshine it will feel pleasantly warm in a light northeasterly breeze .
maximum temperature : 23c ( 73f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: new charity sponsor for great eastern run
text: the perkins great eastern run has announced a new charity partnership .
the peterborough half-marathon has linked-up with the jane tomlinson appeal .
jane lived in the city , but died in 2007 after living with terminal breast cancer for 7 years .
jane 's daughter , rebecca ( number 942 in the photo ) who was born in the city will be running the 13.1-mile race in october .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : perkins parkway remains closed invictus medal on it 's way to papworth hospital
text: here are the stories making the news this lunchtime .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: tour marks first day in job for cambridgeshire pcc
text: it seems like it 's already a busy day for jason ablewhite in his new job as police and crime commissioner for cambridgeshire .
his first job was a tour of parkside police station in cambridge .
starting day 1 as pcc with tour of parkside police station with area commander jon hutchinson @ twitterid

documents.title: biker deaths rocket on cambridgeshire roadscambridge news
text: shock figures reveal the number of bikers killed on cambridgeshire roads has rocketed as police call on motorcyclists to go back to school .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: a14 upgrade met with caution by cambridge mp
text: the mp for cambridge says he 's cautious the a14 upgrade will be built .
the news broke yesterday that the £ 1.6bn scheme has finally been given approval .
daniel zeichner says anything can happen in the world of politics and that he 'll only celebrate when it 's been built .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : one lane blocked on a14 westbound
text: there are still problems on the a14 this morning , one lane is blocked on the westbound carriageway between junction 39 for kentford and junction 38 for the a11 .
it 's because of an accident between a car and a lorry .
a14 westbound between j39 and j38 | accident
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: peterborough choir hits all the right notes
text: a peterborough choir is celebrating after winning a gold medal at a top singing competition .
rhapsody chorus , a four-part ladies harmony group , say they 're `` over the moon '' to have been crowned the best small chorus at the quartet of nations .
they 're hoping to sing at a special convention in las vegas next year but have to be placed in the top five in the world and they 've got to wait a little bit longer for that result .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: franks perkins parkway closed
text: the frank perkins parkway in peterborough remains closed this morning after a police incident .
it 's been closed since 05:00 and there 's now queuing traffic and long delays in both directions between junction 7 , oxney road and junction 8 of the parkway .
congestion is also at junction 4 of the parkway , to the a15 paston parkway junction and the a47 junction and on oxney road to the parnwell way .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: us soldier praises papworth team who saved her life
text: the us solider who 's handed her gold medal won at the invictus games to papworth hospital says she did it because `` they absolutely saved my life and i ca n't thank the uk enough for having that kind of medical support and taking such good care of me . ''
sgt elizabeth marks gave her medal to prince happy after the cambridgeshire hospital saved her life two years ago .
she paid tribute to the nhs , saying : `` what you 're doing is wonderful . ''

documents.title: ace appointment for cambridge college
text: one of the biggest names in tennis will be cambridge today after being made an honorary fellow at lucy cavendish college .
the college says it 's delighted to welcome martina navratilova because she highlights the value placed on excellence in all fields - including sport .
she 'll give a talk about her career and life to students and alumnae at a sold-out event this evening .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: first day on the job for cambridgeshire police and crime commissioner
text: today is the first day in the job for the new police and crime commissioner for cambridgeshire .
jason ablewhite officially took over from sir graham bright this morning who did n't restand for election after four years in the post .
mr ablewhite , a former food industry senior manager who retired in 2015 to concentrate on politics .
he 's been a councillor in st ives , where he lives , since 2005 .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: people from more deprived areas 'are more likely to eat unhealthily '
text: a study carried out by cambridge university has found less well educated people living in neighbourhoods full of takeaways may be particularly unhealthy .
the research was carried out across cambridgeshire , and found that people from more deprived backgrounds are likely to eat more takeaway food and to be overweight .
the team at the centre for diet and activity research ( cedar ) used data from 6,000 cambridgeshire adults , aged between 29 and 62 .
read more about the findings here .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : delays on rail services in from cambridge through to ely
text: there are delays up to 30 minutes on great northern services between littleport and waterbeach due to a signalling problem .
due to a points failure between shippea hill and # ely services running through these stations may be delayed by 15 minutes or revised .
kb
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: invictus games gold medal winner gives award to papworth hospital
text: a us soldier whose life was saved at papworth hospital has given her invictus games gold medal to prince harry to return it to the medical team that treated her .
sergeant elizabeth marks was treated in cambridgeshire on the eve of the first games for injured military and veterans in 2014 , when she collapsed with a serious lung condition .
now , after winning 100m freestyle gold , she said : `` i 'll never be able to repay the wonderful staff , but i hope this medal will find its way back to you at papworth . ''

documents.title: travel : a14 newmarket update
text: the recovery of a car that caught fire on the a14 this morning , westbound close to newmarket has started .
one lane remains closed .
recovery is on scene for the car that caught fireon # a14 w/b j37-j36 near # newmarket .
1 lane remains closed to facilitate this .

documents.title: weather : highs of 23c expected
text: it 's a cloudy start to the day , but during the morning the cloud will break with most parts seeing sunny spells through this afternoon .
maximum temperature : 23c ( 73f ) .

BBC Look East weather

documents.title: travel : one lane closed on a14 westbound by newmarket
text: one lane is closed and there 's slow traffic on the a14 westbound in newmarket near the rowley mile services junction , because of a vehicle fire .
there 's congestion to the a11 junction .
update : # a14 westbound after j37 a142 / newmarket .
one lane closed due to vehicle fire .
queues back past j38 waterhall / a11 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: travel : perkins parkway closed while the police deal with an incident
text: drivers are being urged to avoid the frank perkins parkway in peterborough because of an ongoing police incident .
police were called by the ambulance service just after 04:00 to reports of concern for a woman .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning

we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18:00 .
